security_audit.summary: This skill only provides documentation templates and guidelines. It does not execute any code, access files, make network calls, or interact with system resources. It simply shows developers how to format file header comments.

content.value_statement: Inconsistent file headers make codebases hard to navigate. This skill automatically adds standardized @input/@output/@pos comments to new files.
actual_capabilities: Provides templates for TS/JS, Python, and Shell file headers
Includes warning to sync with CLAUDE.md files
Exempts config files, stylesheets, and generated files
Works with fractal-docs-generator for directory-level docs
limitations: Only provides templates - doesn't auto-insert headers
Limited to three programming languages (TS/JS, Python, Shell)
No customization options for header format
Manual sync required with CLAUDE.md files

use_cases.title: Standardize codebase documentation
use_cases.description: Ensure all new files follow consistent header format with clear input/output/position documentation.

use_cases.title: Improve code clarity for contributors
use_cases.description: Help contributors understand file dependencies and purpose through standardized headers.

use_cases.title: Maintain architectural consistency
use_cases.description: Keep code aligned with architectural documentation through synchronized file headers.

prompt_templates.title: Add header to new service
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a new TypeScript service file
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a file header comment to this new UserService.ts file. It depends on Prisma for database access and provides CRUD operations for users. Position it in the user module.

prompt_templates.title: Document Python utility
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a header for this data_utils.py file. It takes CSV input and outputs JSON, positioned in the analytics module.

prompt_templates.title: Shell script header
prompt_templates.prompt: Add header documentation to deploy.sh. It depends on Docker CLI and provides deployment automation for staging environment.

prompt_templates.title: Update existing header
prompt_templates.prompt: Update this file header - the module now also depends on Redis cache and provides real-time notifications in addition to its current functionality.

output_examples.input: Add header to new authentication middleware
output: * @output AuthMiddleware: validate requests, attach user context
* @pos    API gateway layer, protects all routes

best_practices: Always update headers when file dependencies or purpose changes
Use consistent terminology across all file headers in a project
anti_patterns: Don't copy headers without updating the specific details
Avoid vague descriptions like 'utility functions' or 'helpers'
Don't skip headers for small files - consistency matters

faq.question: Which files are exempt from headers?
faq.answer: Configuration files (JSON/YAML), stylesheets (CSS), generated files (*.d.ts), and node_modules are exempt.

faq.question: How does this integrate with CLAUDE.md files?
faq.answer: The header includes a warning to sync changes with directory-level CLAUDE.md documentation for consistency.

faq.question: Can I customize the header format?
faq.answer: Currently, the format is fixed to @input/@output/@pos structure for standardization across projects.

faq.question: Does this automatically insert headers?
faq.answer: No, it provides templates and guidelines. You manually apply them when creating or modifying files.

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: TypeScript/JavaScript, Python, and Shell scripts have specific header templates provided.

faq.question: How does it work with fractal-docs-generator?
faq.answer: File-header-guardian handles individual file headers while fractal-docs-generator manages directory-level documentation.
